question: Bring out the only statement, which is not fully correct:
option1: An increase in the supply of money will always result in inflation
option2: Inflation occurs when the value of money declines
option3: Cost inflation occurs when prices rise to cover increased factor costs
option4: Inflation will have the effect of redistributing incomes within a country
answer: An increase in the supply of money will always result in inflation
explanation: An increase in money supply will NOT Always result in inflation. An increase in the money supply can cause a sustained increase in real production instead of inflation in the aftermath of a recession, when many resources are underutilized. However, it should not be trapped in the financial system as excess reserves.
